ygData.subject: Re: The Past

(I'm glad to be back ^_^ I've been really busy getting ready for school {it 
starts in two days!!}. I can post now, but starting the seventh I can only 
post late in the afternoon, cause of school, *Grrrrrrr* ^_^)

Tavatron stirred softly in her slumber, almost as if she were about to wake. 
The sound of running water and gentle winds lulled her back into a somewhat 
peaceful sleep. The ground beneath her body was surprisingly cool, despite 
the amount of time she had spent upon it. Part of her never wanted to wake, 
knowing that once she did Dinobot would insist they return to the base for 
repairs. The other part, however, knew she was only at 65, 70% power and in 
desperate need of repairs. These thoughts, however, seemed to be nothing 
more than a dream themselves, slipping from her mind like sand running 
through her fingers.

Her mind drifted back to a more carefree time. A time without rules or 
boundries, just fun. She remembered wandering the streets as she scanned the 
crowd for an easy target. Once spotted she raised her sword high above her 
head so as to reflect the morning light. On cue a small 'bot ran across the 
street, bumping into the intended target. He continued on his way. He was 
only a kid, not much older than Tavatron. Most 'bots just ignored him or 
yelled some single-word insult at his fast departing form.

Life had been like this for as long as they could remember. Neither of them 
had ever known their parents, they had grown to depend upon each other for 
the necessities of life. They stole, harrassed, and often times slept in 
long abandoned buildings, doing what they could to survive. It had gone on 
like this for years, until the day they were caught. They had stolen from 
the wrong 'bot in a desperate attempt to feed themselves. They were offered 
a choice, join the forces or be placed in seperate homes, never to see each 
other again. The choice seemed clear at the time. They did what they had to 
do to survive. They always had...

With much effort Tavatron managed to finally pull herself from her deep 
slumber. She blinked multiple times before finally realizing where she was. 
She stretched silently before standing, gazing at her still reflection in 
the water. So much had happened since then. So many battles, so much death, 
it all blended to become her life, a life she had grown to love despite 
herself. The life of a warrior. Her heart had thawed over time, making her 
appear weak in the eyes of some. Tosome, however, her weakness was seen as 
her greatest strength. With a sighe she raised her head to the sky:

"We should get going. They must be worried about us."
